description.text: In an ideal world youâ€™d try to save as much as you can afford each month. But we know that starting to save money can be tough, especially if you're saving for the first time.Â

posts.title: Which savings account is best for a lump sum of money?

description.text: It's important to consider all the options of savings accounts when it comes to what you should do with a lump sum of money.

posts.title: How to save money as a student

description.text: Stay in control of your spending with our budgeting guide for students. Weâ€™ve explained how to calculate a budget, set spending allowances and stick to them. Plus, we have some handy tips for saving and earning money at uni.

posts.title: Tax free savings allowance - what is yours and where to find it

description.text: Your tax free savings allowance, also known as a Personal Savings Allowance, is a way for most people to earn interest from savings without paying tax!

posts.title: What is a regular savings account?

description.text: With a regular savings account you commit to paying a set amount every month whilst getting a higher interest rate than you'd get with a current account.

posts.title: How does a savings account work?

description.text: A savings account is a place to keep money so that it earns interest. Here's a brief guide on how savings accounts work!
